review_blob: Bottle from cotteridge wines. Dark & lovely. Another great effort from Kernel. Jet black, big piney hop nose, grapefruit with just enough boom from the dark malts to balance the flavors out perfectly. Hints of coffee towards the end. Hope they do this one again.
beer_name: The Kernel / Brodies Scanner Darkly Black India Pale Ale

review_blob: bottle from Cotteridge wines. Right then this is the last time i try a sour/wild ale. i cant get my head around them. This is more like an alchopop than a beer. Like an alcoholic lilt. Was fresh and not at all sweet as i was expecting and the pineapple was not overpowering. it was drinkable but i think ill stick to non fruitbased beers from now on. just not my bag.

on tap at brewdog birmingham. great concept here and something i beleive they should continue trying. on this occassion its just a bit underwhelming. pours dark brown, smells of dirty hops and fresh bread. taste is smooth if a little thin. like a hazlenut latte. overall drinkable and would have again but i think the people could have chosen something better.

bottle from cotteridge wines. not a teribbly exciting DIPA. Deep orange in colour, with a light citrus hop nose. Taste is pithy orange and slight hint of grapefruit. Fairly high bitterness almost astrigent. it was ok.

Word of advice to Greene king. Actually try an American ipa before trying to brew one. Sweeter and fruitier than the standard uk ipa, but by no means does it even come close to a us ipa. Dont be fooled.

Bottle from cotteridge wines. Perfect example of a light session ale packed full of flavour and attitude. Soft golden ale with lovely citrus fruits and well balanced bitterness. Could drink this all day. Buxton showing how its done again.

Ok, everything you expect in a porter is here. Boxes ticked. However its all a bit lightweight. Dark, with hints of smokeyness. Chocolate and coffee from the malt and fruits from the hops. But all very thin. Unexciting.

Bottle from cotteridge wines. This is an ok porter. thats it. all the characteristics are there. Dark, smokey. Malt does all the talking here, hops are way in the background. Roast coffee and hints of chocolate. There is really nothing special here and i have had may porters as good and a few much better. Not quite sure how it has scored so high on here.
Bottle from cotteridge wines. Yummy. Pours dark gold with big fruit and hop nose. Tastes of stone fruits. Very smooth and very more ish. Another Red Willow winner and all wrapped up at under 5% abv.
Dull boring average. No reason to seek this out. Just a big standard English ale. Could be any old pint.
This drinks like a good lager. Clean crisp & refreshing. Good for a hot summers day. Citrus is not overpowering and add a nice edge to it.
This is a big bad mofo. Black, with a massive cocoa nose. Tastes big and boozy. Bold dark chocolate with Christmas pudding fruits, probably from the coffee. Smooth rich and warming. Good stuff.

Bottle from local M&S.; Pours a nice amber with a liight white head. has a very light aroma of hops and a bit of cereal. taste is very light, slight bitterness coming through. Body is also very thin, watery almost. Finish is bitter but short. Basically not enough of anything here to make it worth recommending. The basis of a good beer but just that, a simple UK take on an American ale, without any of the attitude. im suprised it came out at 2.9 actually.
beer_name: Marks & Spencer Single Variety Hop Cascade Pale Ale

review_blob: Bottle from Cotteridge wines. Before i go on i will firstly make it clear that sour ales aint really my bag but was interested in checking out Rocky Heads new lines. The initially thoughts were looking good as i opened the bottle and poured. A hazy golden pour with a fluffy white head. aroma of boiled fruit sweets. The taste was...well..sour i suppose. Initally fruit quickly wiped away by a BIG lemony zing, lemon sherberts as Rich said. Quite a light beer for over 6% with a faily high carb. overall its a fair beer, however as i said sour beers are not my thing but can imagine this going down well on a hot summers day.

Bottle from cotteridge wines. this has a lovely hop aroma on pouring. Very resinous. Pours a dark amber with small white head. Taste is initially light but with a big hop bitterness coming in right after. Hints of spice then are overtaken by a real grapefruity peachy mouth. I enjoyed this the more i drank it. the taste remained in my mouth for a good while after. reminded me of Arbors Yakima valley from a few years back. pretty good id say.

Bottle from cotteridge wines. Damn, another great beer from these dudes! Pours light copper with a thin head. Aroma is fruity hops. Taste is pure American hops, and feels like a fair amount of them. Lots of pineapple and grapefruit coming through with a fair bitter wack. Low carb and quite light but man it packs a punch in the mouth. Very nice.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Good rye beers are hard to come by in the UK so hoorah to Cotteridge Wines for stocking this beautey of a beer.  Pours a dark rust colour with a tight, foamy off white head. The aroma is all cereal and spicy hops. The initial taste is more of the same with some nice floral notes, underpinned with nice light caramel maltiness then finishes with an almost candyfloss like sweetness. overall a complex beer that may not be to everyones taste but judging by the reviews here thats not the case. one of my faves right now.
beer_name: Bear Republic Hop Rod Rye Ale

review_blob: Bottle from Sainsburys. Pours light, pale gold with short whit head. Aroma is light floral nothing to mad. however it really kicks off on the taste front. citrus, floral flovours are so well balance and a great use of the hop varieties make this a very nice drink. light in body but maximum flavour. Nice finish which hints at much strong ABV american IPAs but without the massive bitterness you would associate with them. A great drink for a summer BBQ session for sure.

bottle from cotteridge wines. pours a nice golden colour with a minimal white head. the aroma, as with most Kernal beers, is pungent!! lovely tropical fruits, apricots coming right at cha. Taste is much of the same with the added freshness of the hops problem was it was it was let down by avarage carb, a rather flat mouthfeel with an almost watery finish. a real shame as the inital impressions were so good just let down towards the end.

bottle from cotteridge wines. was looking forward to this but was ultimately dissapointed. initial aroma wasnt bad, typical pine and fruity stuff with hint of caramel coming through. dark amber with small head. i just thought there was far to much going on in the taste department. your usual suspects, toffee malts and juicy fruits were there but then this strange almost vegetable flavour came through and sort of ruined it for me. there was a good amount of bitterness going down as you would expect from a DIPA. overall it wasnt bad, ive tasted much worse, but just wassnt at all as good as i had expected.
beer_name: Buxton Special Reserve V Wyoming Sheep Ranch

review_blob: Bottle from Cotteridge wines. A very nice imperial stout. pours black with nice tan head. aroma is dark and earthy. Taste is just pure dark chocolate and strong coffee all the way with just an earthy hop finish. a nice way to finish an evening.

This is the real deal! The best US BIPA for sure! Bottle from cotteridge wines. Pours a nice black with a thick tan head. The aroma was fairly muted which didnt really set me up for what was to come. Taste was a great balance not to heavy or bitter, spot on. Initial flavours of mocha from the malts and salted caramel. Then the citrus hit from the hops move in with its grapefruit tang and nice lasting bitterness In the mouth. Another great stone. Beer. As it say on the bottle, sublime.
beer_name: Stone Sublimely Self Righteous Black IPA

review_blob: Bottle @ brewdogbirm. Ok I will just start off by saying Damn I love this beer. Seems quite apt seeing as it valentines day to declare my love! Any way on o the rating. Aroma is quite muted considering but this hazy amber beer packs a festival of tropical fruit punch! Seriously, fruit-wise there is shitloads going on but papaya, mango and pineapples are going on here big time. There is a bitterness in the aftermath but considering the high IBU not as much as I was expecting. For a beer of 7.3abv its very forgiving and I could easily drink this all day. God bless American IPAs!!

On tap @ brewdog Birmingham. Probably my favourite brewdog beer, possibly! Tropical power hits the ode straight away, big big bitter hit on he gob followed by some really nice fruits and a bit of toasted sugar too. This is one tasty beer. Went down well with my toasted cheese sarnie, which by the way was also awesome. Great sarnie, great beer, whats not to like!! Good times.

My first wild beer co beer and an impressive one at that. Pours a hazy amber with a thin white head. Initial aroma when poured is fresh wet woodland. Nice. Initial taste is a sweet, fruity one followed up by a punch of hops and a nice bitter follow through. Medium body with light carb. A real taste trip for your taste buds. Sweet, fresh with a nice bitter hit to finish with.

Bottle from cotteridge wines. Pour very cloudy almost like moulted gold. Light citrus aroma on the nose. Taste is pineapple sweetness moving to bitter grapefruit with a nice lasting bitterness. Much like beers of a much stronger ABV but at only 4.4 ABV. Another cracker from the superb Arbor ales. Yum yum!!

Hmm..im wondering if i had a dodgy bottle looking at the past scoring!! anyway, bottle from Cotteridge wines. Pours a nice deep gold with soft white head. No real aroma, quite weak.If anything quite grassy. Taste is very light, medium bitterness. The hops are not standing out here at all. was waiting for that tropical, citrus hit you assocciate with Summit & Cascade hops but its not happening here. This is a very standard UK beer not the international style IPA i was expecting.

Glad I didnt rate until I finished the beer as it grew on me the more I drunk. Bottle from cotteridge wines. Pours nice golden colour. Good carbonation. Lite foamy head. Taste is floral fruits, tangerine with hints of apricots. Nice long bitter finish. A nice alternative IPA. Better than expected.

330ml bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Light aroma of tropical fruits, typical of this style, but lighter than expected. Pours a hazy light orange with thin white head. Taste was a very subtle mix of mango and pineapple with hint of citrus hops, fairly light body for a beer of this strength but with a bitter finish. Not bad really, just not as good as other Kernel beers and other Galaxy IPAs (see Brewdog)
beer_name: The Kernel India Pale Ale Galaxy

review_blob: 500ml bottle from Cotteridge Wines. ok ill start of by saying this is in my current 5 favorite beers. pours a cloudy pale amber with fluffy white head. the aroma is pure citrus sweetness. The taste is very similar with a big big bitter hit of grapefruit, Bam! Soft carbonation just helps with the fizzy citrus palate and full on hops. Bitter finish leaving a linging laste of grapefruit in your mouth. if you are a fan of big citrusy, hoppy beers then this is for you. like an adult, alcoholic version of Ting!!

bottle from stirchley wines. this is one of my fav beers right now. lovely deep amber with nice off white head. big smell of hops and and mangoes. taste is something else, firstly there is sweet caramel, then exotic fruits and finally big hops. very nice mouthfeel almost creamy with a big bitter finish. oh yes it is that good!

bottle from stirchley wines. the one i was least looking forward to was suprisingly good. Amber colour with nice white head. Grassy hop aroma. Nice earthy, spicy hop taste, very english i taste but with more oomph!. nice hoppy aftertaste with just a hint of malt. overall an american style but with british taste. much better than expected would have this again anytime.

bottle from Stirchley Wines. a very different IPA from the others in the series. Pours amber colour with thin white head which dissapeared very quickly. smell was quite alcoholic, but not in the taste. taste was quite different from any other IPA and the first with the HBC variety of hops. Mixture of grassy, herby tastes with a hint of muskyness. aftertaste was quite piney. different but in a fairly good way, but my least favorite from the four pack.

Bottle from stirtchley wines. pours with little white foamy head. nice fruity aroma, and very nice tropical fruit taste particularly pasion fruit and mango. Floral hops in the aftertaste but not overbearing. a very nice summer evening ipa overall.
Very nice. Big pine aroma. Tropical fruits in the mouth with a big grapefruit aftertaste. Overall a very nice single hop ale.
